entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hwīl; akin to Old High German hwīla time, Latin quies rest, quiet

def.dt: :a period of time especially when short and marked by the occurrence of an action or a condition :time stay here for a while
:the time and effort used (as in the performance of an action) :trouble worth your while
:during the time that take a nap while I'm out
:as long as while there's life there's hope
:when on the other hand :whereas easy for an expert, while it is dangerous for a novice
:in spite of the fact that :although while respected, he is not liked
:similarly and at the same time that while the book will be welcomed by scholars, it will make an immediate appeal to the general reader British Book News
:to cause to pass especially without boredom or in a pleasant manner usually used with away while away the time

entry.et: Middle English ones, from genitive of on one

def.dt: :one time and no more rode a horse only once
:at any one time :under any circumstances :ever didn't once thank me
:at some indefinite time in the past :formerly was once a booming mining town
:by one degree of relationship first cousin once removed
